Description of incident: It was discovered that an hourly employee of 19 years was forging checks by using the information of companies who were fined for OSHA violations.  The employee had handled checks for 12 years and may have been involved in a larger fraud operation.  The employee was arrested and fraudulently obtained less than a thousand dollars on average from each company.  A total of 759 companies who paid OSHA fines between January 1, 2009 and November 18, 2010 were affected.  One business owner discovered that a fraudulent check had been cashed for $745 after he paid an OSHA fine of $315.
